title: Sivir's nerfs in comparison to Ashe and Jhin is huge.
body:
Ashes nerfs in comparison to Sivir and even Jhin was a joke. She was arguably the strongest out of the 3 and yet got nerfed the least.

Comparing her Ult nerf of 50 dmg to Sivirs where his attack speed at max rank got reduced to 60% (20% reduction) which used to be his 2nd rank is a huge  hit to his late game is actually astonishing how much Riot hates Sivir.

Ashes q nerf of 1 second is not as bad as it sounds as lane trades/fights are usually over by the 4 second mark meaning she her dps in most fights will not have changed, sure in teamfights her q downtime will hurt but no where near as to Sivir's. 

Jhins nerfs is another joke, directed at completely the wrong places. I don't know what Riots balance team is on tbh.

To top it all of Sivir has another set of nerfs coming on the pbe, and with an 8 second cdr increase max rank on her spellshield with no other nerfs to Ashe.

replies.body: They're smashing her before worlds on purpose so she can't steal the show. She was the star last year at worlds and is on track to be the star this time. They want other major ADCs so they are putting her down now. She will be rebuffed after the worlds patch goes through.
I can see this happening.

I mean it is happening. There is no reason to cut her mana regen in half and take her shield's CD and raising it by 8 seconds late game. What kind of nerf has ever gone that far ever? They typically give little taps, not massive chunks. They're killing her for worlds. It's bad, but I agree with it. I don't want a Sivir dominated Worlds again. You will see buffs after worlds patch.

I'm pretty sure the biggest change to a champion as a result of their performance in competitive was Olaf, who lost a full 10/20/30 armor penetration on his ultimate which cut his damage practically in half. And then Olaf was shit for like two years.

In the same patch, they also lowered his Q damage by 20 at all ranks, increased his W cooldown from 12 to 16 seconds (33% less uptime) and increased his E cooldown from 4 seconds to 5 at max rank, for another 25% less up time on another skill. 

They nerfed every skill he had but his passive in the same patch, by massive amounts, and then gutted all the items he used as well.  went from a 48% winrate to a 32% winrate overnight, and then stayed sub-40% winrate for the next two years.

She's considered a top pick not for her actual raw dps but rather the utility she provides on her team. Her Q is a long range poking device, her W is an ability that can clear entire waves as well as punish anyone standing close to the wave or even champions in team fights giving both split pushing prowess and safe team fighting. Her spell shield gives her the utility to block spells, a utility that pretty much guarantees her safety and refunds her mana in many match ups. Her R provides utility allowing her team to quickly engage or disengage due to the team wide movement speed buff, this is why she's picked.

> She's considered a top pick not for her actual raw dps but rather the utility she provides on her team

Actually, her damage at 3 items is a factor. The fact that she provides so much utility as well is what pushes her over the top as an S tier pick.
